moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4: I was hoping for a Kings gambit, my fav move nowadays. Oh well, reflexively I  still play f4- ppl have told me this is the Grand prix opening.
moves.2... e6 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Nc6 5. O-O: Want to castle quickly and attack his kingside
moves.7... Na5: I dont think his knight move to a5 accomplishes anything. Knight is pushed to one side of the board.
moves.8. Ba2: And I simply withdraw here, from where this serpent can uncoil and strike its long arm later
moves.9... Bb7 10. Be3: okay, all pieces developed. Now it is 'har har mahadev'- Hindu war cry, lol
moves.10... Nf6 11. Ng5: Decide to attack his kingside, no definite plan as such. Feeling, exploring, needling a superior ranked player
moves.11... h6: withdraw my knight, no I have other ideas. Can you guess?
moves.12. e5: harass his knight, disrupt his center. If h6 x N, then the pawns on his kingside shall be disrupted
moves.12... Nd7: quiz- what would you do now ?? Think.... then see what I did next !!
moves.13. Nxe6: Wham- knight sacrifice- if he takes it ....the fun begins. Fasten yr seatbelts
moves.13... fxe6 14. Qh5+: wham-  the wicked witch blasts into place
moves.14... Kf8 15. Bxe6: He is in trouble. Almost certainly will lose his knight on d7, and if I can only open up the f file.
moves.15... g6: he surprised me with this move,  I had been expecting Q to e8
moves.16. Qxg6: never mind.  gobble gobble for now
Don't like his lsb pointing at my g2 pawn. Dont want complications should his rook move to g8 in the future. Also brings my knight over into the attack
moves.19... Bxe4: oh well, he goes for the exchange
moves.20. dxe4 Rf8: now his turn to harass, rightly so wants to drive my queen away. Note- I am 3 pawns up
moves.21. Qg4+ Kh8: What do I do now?? I think of a way to bring my bishop to c3 with an uncluttered a1- h8 diagonal. watch..
moves.23... Be7 24. Rad1: suddenly, I decide to postpone the move of my dsb for now. bringing this rook here, I kind of eye his queen !!
moves.24... Nc4: his knight springs into life and surprises me. In one move it has centralised and if it moves to e3- it is a royal fork attacking both rooks and queen. Be very careful...
moves.25. Bc3+ Bf6 26. Qg6: Dont mind the bishop exchange for he has lost his h pawn. The defence of his king is crumbling
moves.26... Bd4+ 27. Bxd4+ cxd4: he has blocked off the d file and my bishop could be lost
moves.29... Rf7 30. Qg6+ Kh8 31. Qxf7:
Dont mind if his knight forks me on e3, for my f rook will go to f3- h3, mate.
Hope you enjoyed, this is chess for fun, for adrenalin junkies.
When his pawn came out to harass me on move 11- h6- he had no idea that an attack could materialise from nowhere. COULD HE HAVE SAVED THE GAME AFTER MY KNIGHT SAC- pl let me know.
Pl comment freely and pl rate if you think this game is good.
